# General settings

```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE)
```

Load libraries

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(googlesheets4)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(magrittr)
library(here)
library(ggplot2)
library(knitr)
```

```{r}
gs4_deauth()
```

# Import data

Import google sheet

```{r, message=FALSE}
input_data <- read_sheet("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uR4z8UYCje7CfqYDezbBlBIiSsvyyalfSPwWZEBfcIQ/edit#gid=1639204022", col_types = "c")
```

Save raw dataset to GitHub:

```{r}
write.csv(input_data, here::here("data", "input", "input_data.csv"), row.names = FALSE)
```

## Clean country information

Country information is key in the discussion of the report. We need to clean this information.

Show country names:

```{r}
input_data %>% distinct(country)
```

For one dataset, the field `country` included two countries: `Norway and Russia`. As this information is linked to the Norwegian Institute for Nature Research, we consider the origin of this dataset to be Norwegian. Additionally, we clean `Eesti`, provide the full name for `UK` and use title case for all country names:

```{r}
input_data <-
  input_data %>% 
    mutate(country_clean = 
      recode(country, 
      "Norway and Russia" = "Norway",
      "Eesti" = "Estonia",
      "UK" = "United Kingdom")) %>% 
    mutate(country_clean = str_to_title(country_clean))
```

Compare original and cleaned country names:

```{r}
input_data %>% 
  select(country, country_clean) %>% 
  group_by_all() %>% 
  summarize(n = n())
```

Total number of organizations holding SAS data:

```{r}
input_data %>% 
  distinct(organization_acronym) %>% 
  summarize(records = n())
```

Remove responses for which  `sas_data_yn` = `No` (no SAS data available):

```{r remove non sas data}
input_data %<>% filter(sas_data_yn != "No")
```

## Dataset ID

To link all dataset properties to the right dataset, we generate a dataset identifier here. This will be a combination between the country's ISO code, institution acronym and (in case of multiple datasets per country) dataset acronym.

```{r generate shortname}
  country_clean == "Belgium" & organization == "INBO" ~ "BEL-INBO",
  country_clean == "Belgium" & organization == "RBINS" ~ "BEL-RBINS",
  country_clean == "Germany" & organization == "BSH Federal Maitime and Hydrographic Agency" ~ "DEU-BSH",
  country_clean == "Germany" & organization == "FTZ, Kiel University" & name_and_acronym == "German Marine Biodiversity Monitoring" ~ "DEU-FTZ-GMBM",
  country_clean == "Germany" & organization == "FTZ, Kiel University" & name_and_acronym == "German Seabirds at Sea programme" ~ "DEU-FTZ-GSSP",
  country_clean == "Germany" & organization == "FTZ, Kiel University" & name_and_acronym == "Offshore Seabird Monitoring in the Schleswig-Holstein coastal sea, North Sea" ~ "DEU-FTZ-OSMS",
  country_clean == "Spain" & organization == "AZTI" & name_and_acronym == "BIOMAN" ~ "ESP-AZTI-BIO",
  country_clean == "Spain" & organization == "AZTI" & name_and_acronym == "JUVENA" ~ "ESP-AZTI-JUV",
  country_clean == "Spain" & organization == "Instituto EspaÃ±ol de OceanografÃ­a (IEO)" ~ "ESP-IEO",
  country_clean == "Estonia" & organization == "BirdLife Estonia" ~ "EST-EOS",

  country_clean == "France" ~ "FRA",
```

